segments.text: Back at camp. The sun's setting and it's getting cold fast. Maybe minus 2 by now.
Let me get dinner going. I'm exhausted but in a good way. That hike to the ridge was incredible.
Setting up the stove outside the tent. Never cook inside - carbon monoxide is no joke.
[sound of stove lighting] There we go. Tonight's menu: beef stew, dehydrated. Takes about 10 minutes to rehydrate.
While that cooks, let me reflect on today. This morning I was worried about being alone up here.
But honestly? It's been perfect. The solitude is exactly what I needed after six months of city stress.
No emails, no meetings, no one needing something from me. Just me and the mountain.
The chamois encounter was magical. I keep replaying it in my mind. Seven of them, so close.
Tomorrow I'm thinking about going higher. Maybe try for the 2600 meter peak if conditions are good.
But I'll decide in the morning based on weather. No summit is worth taking stupid risks.
The stew's ready. Let me pour it into my bowl... perfect temperature. Smells better than it has any right to.
You know what's funny? This meal probably costs 8 euros but it tastes like a five-star dinner when you're hungry and exhausted.
After dinner I'll boil water for tea, then get into my sleeping bag. It's going to be a cold night.
But that's what the minus 15 bag is for. I'll be warm enough. Might even sleep better than I do at home.
Already looking forward to tomorrow. Six more days up here. This is going to be good for my soul.

environment.background_sounds: stove hissing, wind, tent fabric, water boiling
